question: What was the main context that leads to the development of the event "National Schism"?
option1: Decision whether Greece should enter World War I or not.
option2: Decision whether Greece should grant independence to Macedonia or not.
option3: Decision whether Greece should enter World War II or not.
option4: Decision whether Greece should grant independence to Cyprus or not.
answer: Decision whether Greece should enter World War I or not.
explanation: The National Schism, sometimes called The Great Division, was a series of disagreements between King Constantine I and Prime Minister Eleftherios Venizelos regarding the foreign policy of Greece in the period of 1910â€“1922 of which the tipping point was whether Greece should enter World War I. Venizelos was in support of the Allies and wanted Greece to join the war on their side, while the pro-German King wanted Greece to remain neutral, which would favour the plans of the Central Powers.
